Add gitian PGP key: wjcloud

events.body:
Verified that the key matches the signature used in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/620

ACK 6a07f33

Hmm... unsure.
Key refers to btcplt.org (Bitcoin Platinum).
I just want to make sure if the key merged into the Core repository will not be used to leverage other things (indirect advertising).

Unrelated note: Since most keys are outdated and keeping them up to date is somewhat of a pain, what about removing all keys and only adding a list of full key fingerprints, to be fed into `gpg` for later download. Right now we need to connect to some pgp key server anyway, as some keys are timed out.

>  Since most keys are outdated and keeping them up to date is somewhat of a pain, what about removing all keys and only adding a list of full key fingerprints, 

Yes, that would be a good idea. Have only the key-fingerprints in the main repo.

With I'd prefer to put up a separate repository with the keys somewhere that it will import from, checking the key fingerprints. Pulling from the keyserver every time, for every build, is fairly slow and takes up unnecessarily resources for them (and it also fails some of the time).
@laanwj You are referring to the maintainers' keys, right?

> @laanwj You are referring to the maintainers' keys, right?

Yes, all keys. Though travis doesn't have to import/check the gitian ones obviously.
Can be closed in case #11909 is merged.
I'm closing this as my ID has changed :D
